snippet: In apartments damaged by Hurricane Sandy, New Yorkers are grappling with questions of paying rents and breaking leases.
abstract: New York is a city full of renters, leaving many people displaced by Hurricane Sandy to grapple with leases, landlords and decisions about whether to move; most pressing question for many renters who may be without critical services for months is whether they can legally get out from under their lease.
lead_paragraph: In apartments damaged by Hurricane Sandy, New Yorkers are grappling with questions of paying rents and breaking leases.

headline.seo: Their Units Unlivable, Many Tenants in N.Y.C. Prepare to Move
